title: biden副總統賀錦麗唔支持貿易戰，但同持批評trump對華政策太軟弱

replies.msg:
佢屌鳩trump收關稅，但同時屌鳩中共鎮壓維吾爾人同香港示威者
佢有份cosponsor香港人權法，亦批評trump嘅香港立場蠢戈軟弱

Harris has objected to the Chinese government's unfair trade practices and theft of American intellectual property, but has sharply criticized President Trump's trade war with China, describing the administration's arbitrary use of tariffs as "counterproductive to its goal of ensuring a level playing field for American companies.” [144]

Harris has also condemned the Chinese government's widespread human rights abuses, emphasizing the mass detention of Uyghur Muslims in the Xinjiang re-education camps and abuse of surveillance for political and religious repression. Harris added that while cooperation with the Chinese may be necessary for global issues like climate change the United States must reclaim its moral authority to stand up forcefully for human rights in China.[145] Harris has expressed her support for the protestors in Hong Kong, co-sponsoring the Hong Kong Human Rights and Democracy Act in October 2019. [146]

She condemned the Hong Kong government's use of excessive force against peaceful protestors and Beijing's failure to respect Hong Kong's sovereignty, as well as criticizing President Trump's weak responses to same. [145]

https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Political_positions_of_Kamala_Harris

quote.msg:
佢屌鳩trump收關稅，但同時屌鳩中共鎮壓維吾爾人同香港示威者
佢有份cosponsor香港人權法，亦批評trump嘅香港立場蠢戈軟弱

Harris has objected to the Chinese government's unfair trade practices and theft of American intellectual property, but has sharply criticized President Trump's trade war with China, describing the administration's arbitrary use of tariffs as "counterproductive to its goal of ensuring a level playing field for American companies.” [144]

Harris has also condemned the Chinese government's widespread human rights abuses, emphasizing the mass detention of Uyghur Muslims in the Xinjiang re-education camps and abuse of surveillance for political and religious repression. Harris added that while cooperation with the Chinese may be necessary for global issues like climate change the United States must reclaim its moral authority to stand up forcefully for human rights in China.[145] Harris has expressed her support for the protestors in Hong Kong, co-sponsoring the Hong Kong Human Rights and Democracy Act in October 2019. [146]

She condemned the Hong Kong government's use of excessive force against peaceful protestors and Beijing's failure to respect Hong Kong's sovereignty, as well as criticizing President Trump's weak responses to same. [145]

https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Political_positions_of_Kamala_Harris
